intro: Veratrum stamineum f. lasiophyllum, commonly known as the purple-flowered white hellebore, is a variant of the white hellebore plant. It is characterized by its striking purple or violet-colored flowers, which stand out against its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in woodland or moist meadow habitats. It belongs to the Melanthiaceae family and is known for its tall, sturdy stems that can reach several feet in height. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticulture.
